column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=webanno.custom.DemoNERRE|NamedentityTags
#T_RL=webanno.custom.DemoRE|NamedentityRelations|BT_webanno.custom.DemoNERRE

#Text=The conventional solid-state reaction method was used to prepare the Na2Co2TeO6 polycrystalline sample by taking the stoichiometric ratios of Na2O (99.99% pure), Co3O4(99.99%pure), and TeO2(99.99% pure) powders, purchased from Alfa Aesar Chemicals.
#Text=These powders were mixed, ground thoroughly and sintered at 800\C in the air for 100 h in the platinum crucible.
#Text=The grinding and sintering were performed several times to obtain the single-phase.
#Text=The self-flux method was used to synthesize the single crystal of Na2Co2TeO6sample.
#Text=The mixture was kept in the aluminium/platinum crucible and then gradually heated at a rate of 5\C/min in the air to reach the 900\C temperature.
#Text=The same temperature was maintained for 30 h, and then slowly cooled down to500\C at the rate of 2\C/h.
#Text=After attaining the room temperature (RT), we collected the Na2Co2TeO6flaky crystals with light purple colour.
#Text=Similarly, we prepared pure and poly-crystalline samples of Na2Ni2TeO6and Na2Cu2TeO6employing the solid-state reaction route.
#Text=The chemicals used for the preparation were Na2O, NiO, CuO, and TeO2powders, taken in stoichiometric proportions thoroughly mixed and kept in the furnace to get a pure phase.
#Text=Single crystals of both the mate-rials were grown using a self-flux method.
#Text=Flaky crystals bearing a light green colour for Na2Ni2TeO6and dark green colour for Na2Cu2TeO6were obtained.
#Text=The excessive flux was washed off with hot 1 M NaOH solution.
#Text=The schematic diagram of the Flux Method and the temperature profile is depicted inFig. 1.
#Text=The structure and phase purity of the sample was confirmed by performing the X-ray diffraction(XRD).
#Text=The XRD measurements were performed by Bruker AXSD8 Advance X-ray diffractometer at RT using the Cu-Karadi-ation.

#Text=Magnetic measurements of magnetic susceptibility (c)at zero fields cooled (ZFC) and field cooled (FC), and magnetic field vs magnetization (M vs H) were performed employing the vibrating sample magnetometer (VSM) option of a QuantumDesign system.
#Text=The specific heat measurements were carried out by a relaxation method using a Quantum Design PPMS-9system.
